vocabinfos.mediumDef:
§ Shamir = "a point" or "thorn"
n pr loc
This name is used for:
1) a town in the mountain district of Judah
2) a town in Ephraim where the judge Tola lived and was buried
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (1)   diamante; (2)   espina, cardo, zarza ; (3a)   ciudad; territorio de Judá; (3b)   hijo de Micaías; descendiente de Uziel; tribu de Leví
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
沙密 这个專有名詞 地名在原文的意思是 "尖點" 或 "刺"
1) 猶大山區中的城鎮
2) 在以法蓮中城鎮, 亦即士師陀拉生活與埋葬之處
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
沙密 这个专有名词 地名在原文的意思是 "尖点" 或 "刺"
1) 犹大山区中的城镇
2) 在以法莲中城镇, 亦即士师陀拉生活与埋葬之处

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man of the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.24.24;
son of: Micah (H4318J)
Another name of sha.mur (שָׁמוּר "Shamir" H8053)
§ Shamir = "a point" or "thorn"
n pr loc
1) a town in the mountain district of Judah
2) a town in Ephraim where the judge Tola lived and was buried
